For anyone willing to waste a few CDs on a test....
Monster Rancher Metropolis: The Laboratory: Technical Research On The Monster Rancher CD Read Process: General Q & A: For anyone willing to waste a few CDs on a test....
By Lisa Shock on Monday, July 31, 2006 - 07:03 pm:

Here are a couple of experimental files I got via email today. I can't test them, but would appreciate it if someone else would -in MR2. This is an attempt to get some discs we haven't found yet.

[CloneCD]
Version=2

[Disc]
TocEntries=5
Sessions=1
DataTracksScrambled=0
CDTextLength=0

[Session 1]
PreGapMode=0
PreGapSubC=0

[Entry 0]
Session=1
Point=0xa0
ADR=0x01
Control=0x00
TrackNo=0
AMin=0
ASec=0
AFrame=0
ALBA=-150
Zero=0
PMin=1
PSec=0
PFrame=0
PLBA=4350

[Entry 1]
Session=1
Point=0xa1
ADR=0x01
Control=0x00
TrackNo=0
AMin=0
ASec=0
AFrame=0
ALBA=-150
Zero=0
PMin=5
PSec=0
PFrame=0
PLBA=22350

[Entry 2]
Session=1
Point=0xa2
ADR=0x01
Control=0x04
TrackNo=0
AMin=0
ASec=0
AFrame=0
ALBA=-150
Zero=0
PMin=39
PSec=42
PFrame=15
PLBA=178515

[Entry 3]

Point=0x01
ADR=0x01
Control=0x00
TrackNo=0
AMin=0
ASec=0
AFrame=0
ALBA=-150
Zero=0

PLBA=32

By Scorpio Maurus on Wednesday, August 9, 2006 - 05:56 am:

By Eggie on Wednesday, August 9, 2006 - 11:16 am:

Ok, well I went home and I tested these by falsifying the CD read data, ( ie making the game believe I put in such and such CD ) and I got what I expected for both. Then I changed the required CD data for the monsters to match that of my Final Fantasy Tactics game and I once again got what I expected from it.

Then I followed John Hawley's advice and lowered the write speed of CloneCD to 1X and was able to make one of these 2 CDs ( the first time I put the CD in it took a while to get it to read, but then it worked ) and I actually got what I expected I would from it... so bottom line is, so far, everything Ive done to re-test these have given me correct results. ( or I should say, what I expected to get )

The only thing I havent tried is to actually pull out the old PSX, plug it in with all the cables, put in the game, get to that point in the game and actually try the CD, which is a hassle Im trying to avoid... short of that, well, I dont know what to tell you...

Since the monsters are rares, I got the "you're not allowed to make these, blabla" message, so I did go and changed some data to give myself those qualifications, but I really doubt that could have affected anything as to what monster you get...

Something on your side is obviously different from my side... that is, either the game version is not the same for some reason, or the CD you made for some reason doesnt match the subcode data, etc.

Maybe I'll just burn the other CD and mail it to Lisa so she can test them out...

By Eggie on Wednesday, August 9, 2006 - 05:59 pm:

Ohhh... here's an idea... why dont you now use CloneCD to make the subcode files out of those CDs and post them. If cloneCD copied everything fine, the subcode file it makes out of those 2 CDs should be the same as the subcode you used to make them... that would be an interesting test...
Oh and I did mess up in one of the files. For the subcode file that has this for entry 2:

[Entry 2]
Session=1
Point=0xa2
ADR=0x01
Control=0x04
TrackNo=0
AMin=0
ASec=0
AFrame=0
ALBA=-150
Zero=0
PMin=61
PSec=4
PFrame=15
PLBA=178515

It should be:

[Entry 2]
Session=1
Point=0xa2
ADR=0x01
Control=0x04
TrackNo=0
AMin=0
ASec=0
AFrame=0
ALBA=-150
Zero=0
PMin=61
PSec=4
PFrame=15
PLBA=274665

The PLBA value I had forgotten to re-calculate it... sorry... in any case, even if that messed things up, the other CD should have worked...
